newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Telstra vote seen late Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Telstra vote seen late Wednesday.

text.p: Minority parties in the Australian Senate have agreed to vote finally on Wednesday on the bill to sell a third of government telecommunications carrier Telstra Corp, Senate sources said.

They also agreed in a meeting with the Liberal-National government to extended sitting hours on Thursday and Friday, the last sitting day for 1997, to ensure that essential budget bills are passed, the sources told Reuters.
"We'll sit on Thursday from 9.30 a.m. (2230 GMT) until midnight (1300 GMT)," one party official said.
The Senate would sit from 9.00 a.m. Friday (2200 GMT Thursday) until Friday evening, local time, in order to finish the budget bills, officials said.
Budget measures at risk in the Senate are worth about a quarter of the A$7.2 billion fiscal tightening that the government has programmed for the year to June 1998.
The bulk of those doubtful measures will be determined by the Senate, in which the government does not have a majority, on Thursday and Friday.
